meanings.definition: To exceed in weight, value, or importance.
meanings.sent1: The elephant outbalanced the mouse in size.
meanings.sent2: Her kindness outbalanced her wealth in the eyes of others.
meanings.sent3: The cake outbalanced the salad at the party.
meanings.sent4: His determination outbalanced his fear of failure.
meanings.sent5: The sun outbalanced the moon in brightness that night.

meanings.definition: To outweigh or surpass in influence or effect.
meanings.sent1: His argument outbalanced hers in the debate.
meanings.sent2: The benefits of exercise outbalanced the risks of inactivity.
meanings.sent3: The laughter of the children outbalanced the seriousness of the meeting.
meanings.sent4: Her smile outbalanced the gloomy weather.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the painting outbalanced its small size.
